subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0029_01C9D546.11C10820
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

James, Unfortunately I didn't hear what you are hearing in these either. My=
 results are pretty much the same as Ricks. In a few instances, I could hea=
r something, but not sure what it was, not even sure if it was a voice or j=
ust a noise or artifact from too much "enhancing".

I am not going to say t=
hat you definitely don't have anything in your recordings, but I can't say =
you have anything either.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rick 
  =
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 10:04 AM
  Subjec=
t: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get





  I opened your folder =
and examined all your files.

  Here are my opinions (I have truncated the =
file names due to laziness):

  ahh_mmm noises, no speech
  call_us noises,=
 no speech
  cal_us (enhanced) several listenings: pixelated, no speech
  c=
ompare_panasonic noises, no speech
  compare_sony noises, no speech
  first=
_epv noises, no speech
  good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedback)
  =
hey_can noises, no speech
  hey_whats noises, no speech
  I_hit noises, no =
speech
  important_date noises, no speech
  keep_moving several listenings:=
 Hellalal see woobeh 
  laugh_evp noises, no speech
  lets_wait several lis=
tenings: noises, no speech
  maybe_gun noises, no speech
  miss_you noises,=
 no speech
  my_question several listenings: no da lee
  oh_ noises, no spe=
ech
  something several listenings: noises, no speech
  that_mans noises, n=
o speech
  that's_jim noises, no speech
  this_one several listenings: nois=
es, no speech
  tomorrow noises, no speech

  The ones that took several li=
stenings I thought I might hear words in, so I examined those several times=
. Sometimes I could sort of hear something that sort of sounded like what y=
ou suggested, but I could also hear it in other ways, or not at all.

  So =
my suggestion to you, if you want to get less subjective conjuctures or sim=
ply less affirmations of your own interpretations, is to post the future on=
es without labels. The labels you give can influence the listeners: when yo=
u have a sound that could be several things, and you note that it sounded l=
ike "keep it moving", the listener can find it nearly impossible to try NOT=
 to hear what you heard, and so not be able to give a fresh perspecive to h=
elp your research methods.

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "James W. Hys=
lope" <clockdryve@...> wrote:
  >
  > Go to my Folder in the files section =
"Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to) decide "FOR ME" and let =
me know if I am of the serious type. In my short time I have gathered enoug=
h "proof" for myself that this method works for ME. And from what I have se=
en from others that I have let "listen" to my files (friends) I am blessed =
with the "ability" to HEAR very low audio artifacts....so this will help me=
 in my RESEARCH. And I am OPEN to any help to reach my goals (or help other=
s) with their goals. Have fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enou=
gh to catch the RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday....it missed a few evp's rea=
l close together (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a di=
fferent number than what I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I was saying in =
recorder) and the male evp said 13....then a female laughs. All this was mi=
ssed by the DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in both recorders) BUT then the=
 DR60 "caught" the B7 "napping" at near the end of the 5 second clip....the=
 DR60 heard "let me out" in a clear (quite) males voice. So this is very pr=
omising piece of evidence for me. **those 2 recordings have been uploaded t=
o my folder. I will include an Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), Panasonic RR=
-US360 (when I think to grab it) and my RR-QR80 to go with my RR-QR100, and=
 one more (can't remember what brand-model of this last---due to arrive) LO=
L. I need to build a multiple mounting devise to aid in putting these into =
tandem service. Then I think I will use my Olympus DS-50 as my "Control" re=
corder....by using it on the HQ settings. I am looking to build a "subsonic=
" microphone also (something to do with those low "booms" that I have notic=
ed lead or follow many evp's). So I look forward to any ideas. Falure is NO=
T an option. Haha.....
  >



  
------=_NextPart_000_0029_01C9D546.11C10820
